message_1: A factory produces 500 items on Day 1. Each subsequent day, the number of items produced is 3 times the number produced on the previous day. How many items will the factory produce on Day 5?
message_2:
To find the number of items produced on Day 5, we can use the formula:

Items on Day N = Items on Day 1 * (Production multiplier)^(N-1)

In this case, the production multiplier is 3, and we want to find the number of items produced on Day 5. So, we can plug in the values:

Items on Day 5 = 500 * (3)^(5-1)

Items on Day 5 = 500 * (3)^4

Items on Day 5 = 500 * 81

Items on Day 5 = 40,500

The factory will produce 40,500 items on Day 5.
